title: untargetable being added way too much
body:
it was a hated mechanic on fizz so we add it to nearly every new champ. 
can we stop with this mechanic

replies.body:
{{champion:498}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:164}} 
5 new champs in the past year more then half got untargetable its becoming an issue

> [{quoted}](name=skyfall619,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=61zEeuqT,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-04-24T01:56:30.867+0000)
>
> {{champion:498}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:164}} 
> 5 new champs in the past year more then half got untargetable its becoming an issue

The only time I can see Kled being untargetable from the description of his abilities is when he is dismounted, which is only a second and allows him to dismount before being hit which is completely fair. 

I don't think he is untargetable completely during his ult, maybe just immune to CC which isn't the same thing.

I don't play Kled and haven't been fighting him recently so I don't know fully how the Ult works. It doesn't mention any sort of invulnerability or untargetable-ness in the description I read on the Wiki and site.

I play with/against Kled regularly in Ranked personally. The untargetability is on dismount, and it's one of the most bullshit parts of his kit tbh. It's extremely frustrating and even drops turret aggro, making his dives easy mode as well. Stupid mechanic

Kled isn't untargetable, he's unstoppable, which are two different states. Warwick is also unstoppable when he does his extended Q.

EDIT: He very briefly becomes untargetable during his dismount. That's my B, but let's be real, that brief moment is fairly integral to letting him remount.
Not to mention it's exclusively being put on already hyper mobile champions, as if they weren't safe enough.
Xayah is hyper mobile? That's news to me.
More mobile than vladimir.
No. They both have the same amount of mobility.
Does she have intangibility at all? Kled does during his mount & dismount for example.

Both Xayah and Vladimir have a movement speed boost, both on their W's. 

They also happen to both be able to go untargetable, Vlad on his W, and Xayah on her Ult (although untargetability isn't mobility).

It also appears his a higher ratio, but a shorter duration, than hers;though his costs health while her's doesn't. I've been using untargetability & intangibility interchangeably as they're functionally the same in game; not saying mobility has directly part of the ability to avoid damage in question, but a tendency.
At least it's an ult

I think it's mostly annoying on Fizz because it makes for an easy gapcloser or escape, with a very low CD. It makes more sense on Xayah, since it's her ultimate ability and she'll have to use it meaningfully.

And Camille because she has to completely commit to a fight once she uses it.
so many other champs that have to commit to a fight with there ult so by that logic they should be giving immunity also.
That's not how logic works.

Comparing a 4s cd skill to an ultimate

Lol

I don't need the problem on it for Kled and Xayah. Fizz is an assassin and his untargetability is on a basic skill and be used to engage or escape, that's why it's hated. At least Cam's is on an ult and isn't as flexible.
I'm wondering how much more new champions need CC Immunity before they realize that shit is beyond stupid.
